intro: Didymocarpus leiophyllus, commonly known as the smooth-leaved hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, glossy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
